resources.string: The Archelon is a species of extinct sea turtle known for being the largest of its kind ever documented. Contrary to most sea turtles, the Archelon had a leathery shell, along with a pointed tail and narrow skull. Its diet minly consisted of mollusks, such as squid.

The Wooly Mammoth lived from 1.8 million to 11,000 years ago. They grew up to 11 feet and weighed around 6 tons, which is about the size of a modern-day African elephant. Their diet was herbivourous, which means they ate only plant-based foods. Drastic climate change and hunting contributed to the extiction of these animals, although one population was able to survive on Wrangel Island until 4,000 years ago.

The Saber-Toothed Tiger was ferocious prehistoric cat, whose canine teeth grew up to 7 inches and they could open their mouths up extremely wide. These cats were carnivores, which means their diet consisted of animals, such as woolly mammoths, sloths, and other large prey. They became extict 10,000 years ago due to climate change and hunting.

The Phorusrhacidae was large flightless bird that existed from 62 million to 2.5 million years ago. They were carnivores, and their extiction was most likely due to increasing competition from other carnivores.

The Megatherium was a giant sloth, and at 20 feet tall was one of the largest mammals in history. They were herbivores, using their large claws to strip leaves and bark. The Megatherium went extinct around 10,000 years ago due to human hunting and rapid climate change.

The Mastadon was a prehistoric elephant known for their low shoulders and string tusks. Their diet primarilt consisted of leaves and berries, but could also be found grazing. The Mastadon went extint due to a mass extinction between eras.
Ancient three-toed horses were commonly found in Florida and were about the size of a dog. Most resided either in forests or praries. Many fossils can still be found today.

The Casteroide is an ancient species of beaver known for being the largest beaver to ever exist. The creature is characterized by its large, broad inscisors, and would remain underwater for extended periods of time. The extinction of the Casteriode was most likely caused by widespread ecological restructuring.

The Florida Cave Bear weighed about 650 pounds, roughly the size of a modern-day brown bear. It is charactedized by a dome shaped skull and a very steep forehead. Its teeth are thought to have done more damage than other species of bear. The Cave Bear went extinct around 8,000 years ago.
